alert.note: Alert for Converse County Lower Elevations; North Laramie Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 26 at 5:09PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Converse County through 600 PM MDT... At 508 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Douglas, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Trained Spotter has reported up to penny sized hail with this thunderstorm. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Douglas and Bill. This includes Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 131 and 154. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for east central Wyoming.

area.areaDesc: Converse County Lower Elevations; North Laramie Range
